attributes.action: Hold a referendum in Scotland to give the country a choice to repeal devolution.
attributes.background:
The Scottish government are failing Scotland by focusing on their pursuit for Scottish Independence over governing the country. 

Give Scotland a chance to dissolve Holyrood and repeal devolution, trusting democratically elected Scotland MP's to represent Scotland in Parliament.

attributes.action: Implement an Opt-Out Organ Donation System (as in Wales): LET'S SAVE LIVES
attributes.background: Marnie Brace was born with Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy. At 14 weeks old she went into heart failure & was placed on the heart transplant list. At that time she was the UK's youngest patient awaiting such surgery. Sadly, Marnie is just one of 6,599 people currently awaiting a transplant in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Previously, the government responded that opt-out systems 'might have the potential to deliver benefits' yet it had 'no plans’ to introduce it. Data from the Welsh Government confirms the benefit of the Opt-Out System implemented in 2015:
- 53% of organs donated via deemed consent (32/60 organs)
- Rise: 50% liver transplants; 19% kidney transplants; 63% cardiothoracic transplants
- 38% drop in patients awaiting transplant between 2010/11 & 2015/16
Opt-Out Systems clearly SAVE lives. Please sign!
attributes.creator_name: Sarah Barton (on behalf of Nick & Amy Brace)

attributes.action: All charities to now display the amount of admin and promotion fees clearly.
attributes.background: The charity sector has been infected by greedy promotional companies and business run charities taking well over their share of administration fees. If it was the law to display on promotional signs the actual amount used on charitable activities, the public and the charity would now be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year the charity commission investigates a large number of charity's for fraud. Forces charity's have been worst hit in recent years with the likes of Afghan Heros, 1st Knight, Support our heroes, soldiers off the streets and Local Heroes all being investigated yet very little action is ever taken. 

If the public can clearly see what percentages the charity will receive from their donation, the public can then decide if they still want to give or to choose another charity.

attributes.action: Principles for negotiations with the European Commission for leaving the EU
attributes.background: Any settlement negotiated by the Government must also be ratified by the British Parliament. Negotiations must seek to maintain full membership of the Customs Union while also seeking access to the single market for service industries including the Financial and IT sectors.
attributes.additional_details:
While seeking access to the Single Market Government should seek to mitigate the effect of disproportionate total migration into the U.K. from other EU member states.

Further, in the absence of a negotiated settlement being ratified by Parliament the Government must put the final agreement to a referendum of the British people for a simple vote either to accept the negotiated terms for leaving the EU or to remain within the European Union.

attributes.action: Issue birth certificates for all babies born still from 16 weeks gestation.
attributes.background:
At present if a baby is born sleeping before 24 weeks you get nothing to prove they existed, if after 24 weeks you get a record of stillbirth which helps with statistics of stillbirths. Neither are birth certificates.

We want recognition for all babies lost after 16 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
We have lost two babies at 23 weeks, both were classes as late miscarriages. For Rory we have an official record as he was born at 23 weeks but alive (birth and death certificates issued), for Henry, he didn't officially exist as he was born at 23+1 but was born still.

I laboured both of my babies and I gave birth to them but only one officially exists.

We need to change how baby loss from 16 weeks is recored and recognised. Please sign.

We want recognition for all babies lost after 16 weeks.

attributes.action: Penalise DWP decision makers who give incorrect awards of ESA/DLA or PIP!
attributes.background: More than 60% of DWP decisions are overturned by Tribunals, which shows DWP and/or Assessment companies are in it for the money! Not because they care. Financial penalties would save millions of Tax payers money, They would soon get it right! Appeals should NOT be needed in genuine cases!
attributes.additional_details:
With Some 60% of Tribunal appeals for ESA/DLA and PIP overturning the original decision by the DWP, there should be some type of penalty towards the original Assessor and Decision Maker. 
Where proof is provided by the claimant that the health issues deserve these benefits, and the claimant appeals to Tribunal and wins, the Assessor and the DWP should have a financial penalty. Claimants are 'Sanctioned for missing appointments, let then be sanctioned for getting it wrong!'

attributes.action: Make it law to sell and use only silent fireworks
attributes.background: Firework bangs terrify pets, farm animals, wildlife and young children. For hours on firework night, the weeks before and after and at dozens of other events all year.  The British Fireworks Association says restricting sale and use would increase illegal activity. Silent fireworks are a compromise.
attributes.additional_details:
In  parts of Europe silent fireworks are used increasinlgy to protect pets, livestock and wildlife.  Collecchio, Italy, passed a law in 2015 that all fireworks displays must be quiet.
 The World Health Organization lists 120 decibels as the pain threshold for sound, including sharp sounds such as thunderclaps. Fireworks are louder than that and can lead to hearing loss..
Animals fleeing from fireworks often get lost, injured or killed. Noisy fireworks are not as colourful as silent ones.

attributes.action: Mandatory in depth training and understanding of SEN  for all teaching staff
attributes.background: Teaching staff are under trained in special educational needs and have a lack of understanding for these children. This impacts not only these children but other children in the school. This downfall in education will follow these children in adulthood in forms of depression. This needs to change
attributes.additional_details: After speaking with parents who have childen with special educational needs in mainstream schools, we all agree our main concern is a lack of in depth training/understanding teachers have in our childrens conditions. This has a negative impact on not only our children but family life and others. We feel we aren't listened to in schools. our children are treated as less important within the school. Some get very little help or like my son who is autistic dyspraxic and dyslexic gets no help at all

attributes.action: Give vegans the right to refuse funding the meat industry with their tax money
attributes.background: Veganism is the number one factor in saving the planet, resources, water shortage. Vegans are increasing every day and we feel strongly that our tax is used to fund an industry we find unacceptable. Vegans have the right as Article 9 of the EHRA states, for our views are to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: Recently the new five pound note was found to have tallow in the initial process of manufacture. This has caused outrage not just with vegan groups, the Church but also Muslims. This 'small' problem is now going to be resolved. Why then as vegans in our thousands have we not been given a choice in where our tax money goes. The meat/animal/war industries supported by a huge proportion of our earnings is entirely against our ethics. We therefore wish to question this as it is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Take action so that 237,000 eligible carers get state pension 'Carer's Credits'
attributes.background: The government must do more ensure approximately 237,000 carers receive National Insurance (NI) credits to their state pension. It's estimated that as many as 95% of the 250,000 carers who could get Carer's Credits are not receiving them. They may retire on a lower state pension as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from 2015 showed only 5% of eligible carers were receiving Carer's Credits: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pensions-minister-too-many-carers-missing-out-on-ni-credits

The estimate of only 5% of the estimated 250,000 eligible carers claiming Carer's Credit was provided by DWP from the Family Resources Survey 2014-15, published in June 2016. https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/531242/family-resources-survey-2014-15.pdf

attributes.action: Guarantee the survival of the Urgent Care Centre at K&C Hospital
attributes.background:
If Kent and Canterbury Hospital urgent care centre closed it would potentially signal the end of its life as an acute hospital.
The urgent care centre treats patients with acute medical illnesses, such as heart attacks or strokes.
attributes.additional_details:
“For patients this means even longer waiting time in A&E, either at Ashford or Thanet.”
Changes to hospital services are being carried out amid a chaotic winter period which has seen patients lying on beds in corridors and the trust regularly breaches the four-hour target for waiting times.
Canterbury is a city which has over 150000 residents and we need a fully functioning hospital. We have already lost our A+E department and if we lose our urgent care centre then lives will be lost.

attributes.action: Introduce a 5p charge on single-use plastic straws.
attributes.background: The average plastic straw is used for just 20 minutes, but will long out-live its user. The majority of plastic straws are not recycled, often winding up in landfill or in the ocean. Introduce a 5p charge on plastic straws to reduce the UK's plastic waste, for both the environment and the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Almost every piece of plastic ever produced still exists today. Most single-use plastic straws are discarded, often winding up in landfill, or contributing to the 8 million tons of plastic entering the sea every year.
Following the introduction of the 5p charge on plastic carrier bags in England, usage fell by 85% in just 6 months. Millions have been donated to charity as a result of the scheme and millions more have been saved in clean-up costs. We can achieve the same with plastic straws.

attributes.action: Reinstate the NHS bursary funds for prospective 2017/2018 Nursing students.
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is that government claim there's shortage of nurses in the UK and yet they went ahead to stop the bursary that has been helpful for Nursing students to pay for their tuition fees .Government should reinstate the NHS  bursary funds to encouraging more people into nursing.

attributes.action: Revise the child allowance and maternity pay for multiple birth families
attributes.background:
Currently there is no extra maternity pay for multiple birth parents despite the cost being greater.  
The child allowance doesn't assist either having the second child at a reduced rate.
Both of these should be revised to help parents who are already over worked by a multiple birth.
attributes.additional_details:
The stat maternity pay at the moment is currently between £500-£600 a month which for a single parent is a large drop in salary, but doubled costs (or greater) for twice as many nappies, formula, clothes etc. means that this money is not sufficient for the needs of the family. 
The first child receives standard child benefit, the second however is treated as if they were not born at the same time. 
Multiple births are natural but parents aren't helped with that burden.

attributes.action: Introduce an unconditional, Universal Basic Income
attributes.background:
Working people face unemployment or reduced hours/wages as their jobs are increasingly taken by machines, yet political austerity focusses on reducing welfare.
Pay a Basic Income to every citizen to reduce welfare bureaucracy, increase quality of life, and maintain consumer spending in the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Checkout staff, bank tellers, hospital porters, factory workers, receptionists and warehouse workers are already being displaced by technology. They are soon to be followed by lorry drivers, backroom legal teams, financial analysts, call centre staff, pharmacists, etc. All this is happening far faster than workers can retrain.

(Read 'The Rise of The Robots' by Martin Ford for more.)

A Universal Basic Income eliminates almost all bureaucratic costs of social welfare yet achieves the same aim.

attributes.action: Debate if "Safe Standing" could be introduced to all seater stadia in England
attributes.background:
The most impactful recommendation of the Taylor report in 1989 was the requirement that all football stadia in the top two divisions of English football had to be all seater. 

Large numbers of fans still stand at football matches and would like to continue to do this in a safe and legal manner.
attributes.additional_details:
Taylor report - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taylor_Report

Safe standing article (admittedly with a rail seat firm) - http://www.joe.co.uk/sport/safe-standing-qa/91188

Safe Standing facts from the Football Supporters Federation - http://www.fsf.org.uk/campaigns/safe-standing/safe-standing-facts/

attributes.action: To make Crohn's disease a disability as it's a life-time illness
attributes.background: My wife has suffered for many years. We are in a council flat with 1 toilet and life is really hard. We have requested 2 toilets as we can't even let the kids use it as she needs access 24/7.
attributes.additional_details:
Life is really hard but the council won't do anything as it's not a disability. We've tried to get pip but no.
You need your own personal toilet 
You can't work full time 
Once every 2 years min your having operations

attributes.action: Government to introduce different regulations around indemnity insurance for IM
attributes.background: Due to the current governing body for midwifery (The NMC)stating that current independent midwifery practice indemnity insurance is not sufficient we are asking for the government to introduce different regulations that will provide adequate indemnity insurance for independent midwives.

attributes.action: Apologise to the people of India for the atrocities carried out by the Empire
attributes.background: An Indian MP described Britain's attitude to the horrors of the Empire as "historical amnesia". 100s of people were massacred in Amritsar, 3 million deliberately starved to death in Bengal & vast produce/resources looted. An apology can help Britain atone for its collective historic moral failure.

attributes.action: Prevent fracking in the village of Marsh Lane and the Town of Eckington
attributes.background: Fracking has been proposed in the area of Eckington. The people of the area do not want fracking to occur due to the damages that are linked to it such as Sink Holes, pollution to the water table, heavy plant traffic on small B roads and the eye-sore that it will cause to the local area.

attributes.action: Regulation of changeover fees charged by caravan site owners
attributes.background: Make it illegal for static caravan site owners to charge a fee in respect of change of ownership of a caravan where the sale is a private sale and the caravan site has had no involvement in the sale. Also to cap the fees charged where the site owner has sold a caravan on behalf of an owner

attributes.action: Ban ALL antifreeze preparations unless they contain a bitterant
attributes.background: Antifreeze products like screen wash contain Ethylene Glycol that is highly toxic and kills 1000's of pets each year.  A teaspoon is enough to kill a cat, a tablespoon a dog.  Adding a bittering agent to ALL products would take away the sweet taste and discourage animals from licking any spills.

attributes.action: Irlen Syndrome should be recognised by the NHS.
attributes.background: Irlen Syndrome is more common than heart disease or asthma and affects 15% of the General Public, impacting on all aspects of everyday life. It is a perceptual processing disorder, not an optical problem. It is a problem with the brain's ability to process visual information.

attributes.action: Provide Orkambi for Cystic Fibrosis patients in England.
attributes.background: Orkambi (ivacaftor and lumacaftor) is a gene therapy based drug used to help treat CF for the most common gene (deltaF508). Use in Cystic patients can reduce lung function decline from 2.3% annually to 1.3% a significant improvement over the course of a cystics life.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37795460

attributes.action: Publish the ongoing and projected costs of Brexit
attributes.background: The government should set up an independent body to record and publish the ongoing and projected costs to the country and the people of leaving the European Union. This is essential for everyone to understand the financial impact of the referendum vote and any future decisions made.
attributes.additional_details: There has been great uncertainty about the future financial impact of the vote to leave the European Union. Now that the leave process is in progress it should be possible to calculate the ongoing costs of the decision to leave. It should also be possible to have a clearer idea of the future impact both for what we would save and for what we are likely to expend. This would inform us all of the net financial benefits of leaving the European Union.

attributes.action: Withdraw new TPD regulations that are affecting the vape industry
attributes.background: I believe all new regulations regarding vaping should be withdrawn, as a healthier alternative to smoking this shouldn't regulated in the sense that items are illegal to obtain but rather supported to assist those on giving up smoking and a healthier choice that I'd 97% safer than smoking
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a link to the details on all new compliances that we must abide by
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/e-cigarettes-regulations-for-consumer-products
It is having all effect on a lot of companies large and small, especially those just starting out in the industry and I believe it should be rethought

attributes.action: We want the UK Government to ban the sale of all arms to Israel
attributes.background: Israel refuses to comply with international law. Israel commits flagrant human rights abuses and atrocities against the Palestinian people.

attributes.action: Don’t Railroad Soho: Save Soho from the CrossRail 2 Scheme
attributes.background: The future of Soho could change dramatically this coming June when we anticipate the transport minister announcing the approval of CrossRail 2. It will allow the demolition of two blocks for a new train station that will bring double the footfall of Kings Cross Underground into and around Soho.
attributes.additional_details:
That’s 270 thousand people every three hour peak right on the corner of Frith Street and Shaftesbury Avenue.  

We do not oppose CrossRail 2.  However, we oppose any decision to include Soho in the scheme.  

I have supported the Save Soho movement since it began and have assisted Tim Arnold and the Save Soho group whenever possible. 

Please join us by signing this petition for yours and our Soho.

Stephen Fry, chairman of Save Soho

attributes.action: To stop supporting Saudi Arabia as they massacre the Yemeni people
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia, backed by Britain, have been launching airstrikes in neighbouring Yemen, the Arab world's poorest country, killing innocent civilians and violating international humanitarian law, and despite horrific human rights abuses, this war has not captured the attention of the Western public.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.fidh.org/en/region/north-africa-middle-east/saudi-arabia/suspend-saudi-arabia-from-the-un-human-rights-council

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/jeremy-corbyn-accuses-theresa-may-of-sacrificing-human-rights-to-sell-weapons-to-saudi-arabia_uk_584ad43be4b0b7ff851cf979

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/sep/24/yemen-britain-human-rights-inquiry

Stop The War On Yemen: https://www.facebook.com/StopTheWarOnYemen/?fref=ts

attributes.action: Allow The Speaker of The House to silence MP's who attempt to 'talk out' a bill
attributes.background: It is a disgrace that members waste time during a debate in order to stall a vote. This process is anti-democratic and stops important bills - such as a recent bill on domestic abuse - from passing. The speaker should be allowed to stop anyone attempting to filibuster.

attributes.action: To save the 16 remaining hospital beds at Okehampton Hospital
attributes.background: The Clinical Commission Group are proposing to remove the 16 remaining hospital beds at Okehampton Hospital. Residents of Okehampton and the surrounding area, urge the retention of our local hospital beds. Okehampton is the hub of a huge rural area with a population of 20,000 people. .
attributes.additional_details:
Okehampton is geographically isolated from East Devon hospitals where beds are retained for non-acute care.
 
The frail and elderly need local pre and post op beds for rehabilitation and nursing care 24/7 and a proper care package before they go home. With poor public transport some friends and families already travel many miles to get to Okehampton.

attributes.action: Entitle Student Nurses and Midwives Access to the 30 Hours Funded Childcare
attributes.background: 30 hours free childcare is going to be made ONLY available to working families, where both parents do paid work. I would simply like to request that this support is extended to Student Nurses, Midwives and other medical professionals with children in recognition of full time working placement hours.
attributes.additional_details: There is a huge financial strain on Student Nurses and Midwives. The government support with this matter would relieve some of this financial pressure. Although whilst working placement hours students are not contracted to the NHS or paid for their efforts, the contact time mirrors that of a full time job. Consequently, 30 hours funded childcare would be greatly benificial and help relieve some of the financial burden medical students selflessly undergo to serve the health service & UK citizens.

attributes.action: Help disabled people to work by abolishing the cap on Access to Work payments
attributes.background: The Access to Work Scheme helps disabled people to work by paying for the extra costs they face. In April 2018, the Government is planning to impose an arbitrary cap on how much money a person can claim. This will make it far harder for disabled people to find and keep a job.
attributes.additional_details: ATW enables disabled people to work by paying for equipment, PAs or extra travel costs. From April 2018, people will not be able to claim over £40,800 a year. This cap will only save £3 million but make it almost impossible for severely disabled people to work and cause huge distress. It contradicts the Government’s aim to increase the number of disabled people with jobs. It also does not make economic sense. For every £1 spent on ATW, £1.48 returns to the Exchequer in tax or benefits savings.

attributes.action: Make Autism Spectrum training compulsory for all mental health professionals.
attributes.background: It is surprising how little knowledge mental health professionals, in general, have of ASD. Having ASD can affect how individuals portray their symptoms of their mental health problems and lack of knowledge of the spectrum can lead to wrong diagnoses and ineffective treatment plans.
attributes.additional_details: Many MH professionals feel that they don't know how best to help us as they don't understand the differences in the MH problems we experience. They have indicated that individuals tend to get left to one side as they aren't sure of the best treatments/type of support for them. Dangers of lack of correct support and misdiagnoses can lead to permanent health problems or even death. Compulsory training would give staff awareness of ASD which would help them to understand how to support us better.

attributes.action: Use Buses Bill to make it mandatory for wheelchair space be vacated for a user
attributes.background:
The Supreme Court judgment requires bus drivers do
more to make non-disabled people move from the wheelchair space if
needed by a disabled person, but many people still refuse. This prevents disabled people from travelling. Bus drivers are in an invidious position.
attributes.additional_details:
Disabled people's organisations and charities are disappointed that the judgment does not give disabled people the absolute right to the wheelchair space. Disabled people campaigned and took action for decades for this space. It was not meant to be "dual use". Some non-disabled people refuse to leave it, preventing disabled people from travelling.

Mumsnet state that disabled people should have priority use of the
space, with separate provision for buggies. The Buses Bill could
implement this.

attributes.action: Equally free GCSE and A Level Exams for Home Educated Children..
attributes.background:
Thousands of UK citizens home educate!  School failed some of these families,  others simply home educate out of personal preference. 

Is it right to disadvantage children educated at zero expense to tax payers? Why then the fees for home educated children to sit GCSEs and A levels?
attributes.additional_details:
For every year I teach my own children, the tax payers save between £3000 and £6000 This is the case for every home educated child. No funding is provided in anyway. I am a single parent and we are a low income family because of our choice, we accept that this will be the case until I have finished teaching the children. 

 However, we do ask  the same free provision of GCSE and A Level examinations  for home educated children,  who should have equal opportunities in this area at the very least.

attributes.action: Demand apology from US government for removing teacher Juhel Miah from US flight
attributes.background: Welsh-Muslim teacher Juhel Miah was removed from a flight to New York even though he had a valid visa and in violation of assurances from Pres Trump. Students he was travelling with were shocked and upset. The British government must immediately demand an explanation and apology from US government.
attributes.additional_details:
Juhel Miah, a Muslim and native born British citizen who is a teacher in Wales, was helping to escort a school trip to New York. While boarding a connecting flight in Reykjavik he was singled out for a security check and denied permission to travel. 

https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2017/feb/20/british-muslim-teacher-denied-entry-to-us-on-school-trip  

We demand that the government stand up against this abuse of Juhel Miah and demand an explanation and apology from the US government.

attributes.action: Save Bridgnorth and Ludlow Maternity Units
attributes.background: Bridgnorth and Ludlow MLU's  are in danger of becoming birthing units and being closed over night.Please show your support and sign this petition.We need to fight to keep these amazing services open 24 hours a day as they are now.
attributes.additional_details: The CCG and SATH have been challenged regarding plans but no details have been announced yet about how rural maternity services will be funded beyond April 2017,  when the current funding contract ends...Please sign this petition.We have growing support now for all 3 Maternity units: Bridgnorth,Ludlow and Oswestry .We have three campaigns running on Facebook  each with over 1000 members, we have had media interest, gained support from our local town council and will be meeting with our local MP.

attributes.action: Investigate the 19 deaths at Orchid View care home
attributes.background: Of the 19 residents who died due to safeguarding failures at Orchid View care home 5 of those deaths were due to neglect. This was stated by the coroner. The families of those five victims, and the other 14 victims, have fought for a Public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details:
Today - October 20th 2016, the families learned from Under Minister David Mowat that their request for a Public Inquiry has been turned down. They remain committed to seeking justice for their lost loved ones, they remain committed to seeking a public inquiry. 
Only 10,000 signatures are needed for the petition to be presented at parliament. Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Include cats on the reportable accident list like dogs and larger animals.
attributes.background: In less than 2 years I have had 3 cats killed after being hit by cars.  All 3 of my cats have just been left either in the road or at the side of the road and nobody has had the decency to let me know. I think it is about time that accidents involving cats should be reported as is the law with dogs.
attributes.additional_details: By letting the owner know that their beloved pet has been hit could be the difference between the cat surviving or passing away, those few minutes after an accident are crucial and could give the pet owner time to get to the vets and potentially save the cats life! I know this will not bring my cats back and it wont prevent more accidents.  But it would mean not so many people lose their pets if they can get them to the vets in time.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of the Taiji Dolphin slaughters with the Japanese Government
attributes.background: I've been horrified to learn & witness that every year in Taiji,Japan, dolphins are chased into a small cover and butchered in the most horrific and cruel way imaginable. The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.
attributes.additional_details: People across the world have been shocked by this act of cruelty that is live streamed by many welfare organisation to raise awareness, e.g. dolphin project, sea shepherd,racing against extinction etc. This year the order book for Taiji is 150 dolphins for captivity, anymore captured will be killed. The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Give a 5 year minimum jail term if convicted of setting up/attending dog fights
attributes.background: A violent and savage example of man manipulating nature to fulfil his own curious bloodlust, dog fighting is rightly banned nearly everywhere in the world. Dog fighting has far from disappeared, in fact it’s a hobby that is distressingly alive and well and appears to be on the increase!
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs forced into fighting suffer terrible injuries, both from the fights and at the hands of their vicious owners. Death, blood and violence is a par for the course in the dog fighting world, compassion or conscience for the ‘losing’ dog is not an issue the average dog-fighter will concern themselves with.

In order to offer a sufficient deterrent I ask that those convicted of arranging/attending dog fights are to be given a mandatory custodial sentence of a minimum 5 years.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from the UK driving licence.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016 the British people voted to Leave the EU. Now MP's have voted to accept the PM's Article 50 bill and triggering the process of leaving is imminent, we petition the Government to order the removal of the EU flag from all newly issued UK driving licenses.
attributes.additional_details: The EU flag as defined by the circle of yellow stars on the rectangular blue background. Once Britain leaves the political Union, this symbol will not only be outdated but will have no place on official documents such as the UK driving license. The symbol, appearing on official government issued documents, signifies the EU’s power over those institutions issuing said documents. Britain leaving the EU means that the EU no longer has any jurisdiction over these British government institutions.

attributes.action: Save Oswestry Maternity Unit
attributes.background: Oswestry MLU it is in danger of becoming a birthing unit. Add your voice to this petition to keep this unit open full time & keep this amazing service,  vital not only for births in Shropshire & Powys but to keep the amazing ante & post natal care so many of us have been lucky enough to receive.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from The Shropshire Star:

Fears have been raised because no details have been announced about how rural maternity services such as those at Ludlow, Bridgnorth and Oswestry are to be funded beyond April 2017 when the current funding contract ends.

Shrewsbury and Telford Hospitals NHS Trust, which runs the Ludlow midwife-led unit, insists there are no plans to close it permanently.

However the financial recovery plan for the trust lists one of the possible changes as converting three midwife led units to birthing centres.


Read more at http://www.shropshirestar.com/news/health/2016/12/12/call-for-clarity-over-shropshires-rural-maternity-units/#708l6fDDyjgG1DFp.99

attributes.action: Theresa May should allow the elected Scottish Government decide Referendum Date
attributes.background:
Theresa May aims to block the Scottish Referendum due to the upcoming Brexit Talks and feels that this should not take place until after Brexit. 

The SNP aim to offer a referendum question when Brexit Talks are near completion and the British Government are aware of their position.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-39293513 

http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/staggers/2017/03/brexit-makes-scottish-independence-much-more-economically-attractive

attributes.action: Introduce government funding for The Medical Detection Dogs charity.
attributes.background: Dogs can be trained to detect certain cancers in urine samples, quickly, accurately and at less cost to the NHS. They make possible the earlier identification  of some difficult to detect cancers. They can also assist people by alerting them to imminent medical dangers. Yet they receive no funding.
attributes.additional_details: This charity has changed the lives of individuals with diabetes, epilepsy, narcolepsy and serious allergies, by giving them greater security and independence. The Medical Assistance  dogs help their confidence and general well being and in some cases enables them to lead a normal life. The charity saves the NHS more money by reducing the emergency call out incidents. Its worthwhile work could be extended to help many more people, given money and recognition.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts to offer a minimum of 2 funded fertility treatments.
attributes.background:
We have been struggling with infertilty for the last 6 years, we have had various drugs and one Funded IVF cycle.
We got pregnant with IVF. Our baby boy was born pre-term (18wks) and didn't survive. 
This petition is to help others in a similar circumstance to us, to have another NHS funded cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Not all NHS trusts offer the same amount funded cycles.

attributes.action: Reject measures in the Digital Economy Bill to censor legal content online
attributes.background: The Digital Economy Bill has passed its third reading in the Commons. It includes measures to force Internet Service Providers to block pornographic websites which don't verify the age of users via intrusive means, and to censor legal content depicting sexual acts classified "non-conventional".
attributes.additional_details:
This amounts to intrusive and dangerous State censorship of legal content online.

While the Government may claim that the aim is solely to protect children from viewing adult content, the reality is that these measures are unnecessary - when ISPs already provide optional filters for such content, bring severe privacy risks, and establish the precedent and framework to allow the Government to censor legal online content of which it simply does not approve.

These measures must be rejected.

attributes.action: No to a cross-Tamar “Devonwall” parliamentary constituency
attributes.background: The “Boundary Commission for England” is carrying out a review of the boundaries of parliamentary constituencies. The review follows guidelines in the Parliamentary Voting System & Constituencies Act. This does not recognise Cornwall as a political unit and the BCE has proposed a cross-Tamar seat.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that Westminster politicians amend the legislation to “Keep Cornwall Whole” and ensure parliamentary seats lie entirely within the historic boundaries of Cornwall & the Isles of Scilly.

It should be noted that the Government has recognised the Cornish as a national minority through the Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities, and it is evident that the creation of a “Devonwall” seat would be in conflict with the articles of the Framework Convention.

attributes.action: Make the new GCSEs begin for 2017/18 Year 7 class, and not the current Year 10.
attributes.background: Since Year 7, we have been taught under curriculum supporting the old GCSE system. Now, we are suddenly being forced to suddenly change this, and this means students are already struggling and are less likely to reach their full potential.This is affecting our futures and it needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of my teachers are unsure what to teach so suddenly with these new specifications. How are we supposed to achieve and excel with even our teachers not being sure on what we need to know? A one to two year gap until it is taught will ensure teachers can prepare properly, rather than a sudden change. Grades 9-1 are hard to distinguish for students, parents, teachers, and even employers. Did they really need to change so suddenly?
